official-title.#text:
To prohibit States from carrying out more than one
		  Congressional redistricting after a decennial census and
		  apportionment.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was referred to the

header.#text:
Short title; finding of
			 constitutional authority

short-title.#text:
Coretta Scott King Mid-Decade Redistricting
			 Prohibition Act of 2013

text.#text:
This Act may be cited
			 as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
finds that it has the authority to
			 establish the terms and conditions States must follow in carrying out
			 Congressional redistricting after an apportionment of Members of the House of
			 Representatives because—

under article I, section 4 of the Constitution of the
			 United States gives

the power to enact laws governing the time, place,
			 and manner of elections for Members of the House of Representatives; and

under section 5 of the fourteenth amendment to the
			 Constitution gives

the power to enact laws to enforce section 2 of
			 such amendment, which requires Representatives to be apportioned among the
			 several States according to their number.

quote.#text:
A State which has been redistricted in
			 the manner provided by law after an apportionment under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, may not be redistricted
			 again until after the next apportionment of Representatives under such section,
			 unless a court requires the State to conduct such subsequent redistricting to
			 comply with the Constitution or to enforce the

quote.#text:
An Act to provide for the fifteenth and subsequent
			 decennial censuses and to provide for an apportionment of Representatives in
			 Congress

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: An Act to provide for the fifteenth and subsequent decennial censuses and to provide for an apportionment of Representatives in Congress/s:22/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, is amended by
			 adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
An Act for the
			 relief of Doctor Ricardo Vallejo Samala and to provide for congressional
			 redistricting
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: An Act for the relief of Doctor Ricardo Vallejo Samala and to provide for congressional redistricting

header.#text:
Limit on congressional
			 redistricting after an apportionment

text.#text:
Nothing in this Act or in any amendment made
			 by this Act may be construed to affect the manner in which a State carries out
			 elections for State or local office, including the process by which a State
			 establishes the districts used in such elections.

header.#text:
No
			 effect on elections for State and local office

text.#text:
This Act and the
			 amendment made by this Act shall apply with respect to any Congressional
			 redistricting which occurs after the regular decennial census conducted during
			 2020.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 2490 IH: Coretta Scott King Mid-Decade Redistricting Prohibition Act of 2013
